Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ Ward save

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to dispell
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: A Blight of Terrors
Artefact.Description: A model with a Blight of Terror causes terror.

Artefact.Name: A Befuddlement of Mischiefs
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, Power level 3: Magic Missile with a range of 18", it causes the targeted unit to become subject to Stupidity in its next turn
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, Power level 3. The Mischiefs are treated like a Magic Missile spell that has a range of 18". It causes the targeted unit to become subject to Stupidity in its next turn. Those units that are Immune to Psychology are immune to the effects of this spell.

Artefact.Name: A Murder of Spites
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +D6 attacks with Initiative of 4, Strength of 2 and Poisoned Attacks special rules
Artefact.Description: The model gains +D6 attacks in close combat. These are worked out at the bearer's WS, and have an Initiative of 4 and a Strength of 2. In addition, these attacks count as magical, and are Poisoned Attacks.

Artefact.Name: A Muster of Malevolents
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Additional ranged weapon with range of 6", and unleashes D6 Strength 2 shots, always hit on a 4+ and count as magical and Poisoned Attacks special rules
Artefact.Description: A muster counts as a ranged weapon that may be used in addition to any ranged weapon that the model carries. It has a range of 6", and unleashes D6 Strength 2 shots. The model counts as being a single unit Strength 1 model on foot for line of sight for this attack, and it may target a different unit than any other ranged attack made by the character. These shots always hit on a 4+ and count as magical and Poisoned Attacks. A model with Malevolents may stand and shoot with them (in addition to any other ranged weapon the model may have), even if the charging unit is outside the model's line of sightfer. it would not normally be allowed to stand and shoot because the enemy is within half its' charge range. So long as the model has a chance to be contacted by the enemy unit, the character may still stand and shoot.

Artefact.Name: An Annoyance of Netlings
Artefact.Description: In a challenge, any enemy attempting to strike a character with an Annoyance of Netlings will only hit on 6+.

Artefact.Name: A Resplendence of Luminescents
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magical attacks
Artefact.Description: All attacks made by a character with a Resplendence of Luminescents are magical, as are those of any unit that they join.

Artefact.Name: A Lamentation of Despairs
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, Power level 3: Once per game any model on the board must pass a Leadership test, or else suffer D3 automatic wounds that cannot be saved by armour or Ward Saves and cannot be regenerated
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, Power level 3. One use only. Any model on the board may be targeted. The targeted model must pass a Leadership test, or else suffer D3 automatic wounds that cannot be saved by armour or Ward Saves and cannot be regenerated.

Artefact.Name: A Cluster of Radiants
Artefact.Description: Treemen Ancients and Branchwraiths only. A character with Radiants may add one extra dice to their Dispel pool in their opponent's Magic phase.

Artefact.Name: A Pageant of Shrikes
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Additional shooting attack with Strength 4, range of 18" and always hits on a 3+
Artefact.Description: In addition to any shooting attacks the model has, Shrikes confer an additional shooting attack. A Pageant of Shrikes may target a different unit than any other ranged attack made by the character, though it may only be used against a target that the character can see. A Pageant ot Shrikes is a Strength 4 ranged attack that has a range of 18" and always hits on a 3+. This shooting attack is not subject to the usual targeting restrictions apart from line of sight - it can even be used to pick out an individual character within a unit. A model may not stand and shoot with a Pageant of Shrikes.

Artefact.Name: The Spirit Sword
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Enemy that suffers one or more unsaved wounds must roll a D6 and add their Leadership, the character does the same: for each point the character wins by, his opponent loses an additional wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed, for each point his opponent wins by, the character loses a wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Hits by the Spirit Sword wound automatically. Any enemy that suffers one or more unsaved wounds from the Spirit Sword must roll a D6 and add their Leadership - the wielder does the same. For each point the wielder wins by, his opponent loses an additional wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed. For each point his opponent wins by, the wielder loses a wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Daith's Reaper
Artefact.Description: The wielder of this weapon may re-roll any failed hits in close combat. In addition, any foe wounded by this blade must re-roll any successful Armour Saves.

Artefact.Name: The Bow of Loren
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: As many shoot as character have Attacks on their profile
No suffer -1 for multiple shots
Artefact.Description: This longbow allows the bearer to shoot as many times as they have Attacks on their profile. The bearer does nor suffer -1 for multiple shots.

Artefact.Name: Blades of Loec
Artefact.Description: Wardancer Weapons. The wielder can re-roll any failed rolls to wound. May be used in conjuction with the Shadow Dances of Loec.

Artefact.Name: The Dawnspear
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Then character causes an unsaved wound on an enemy, then that model and any other models in the unit that have not yet attacked suffer -1 to hit for that Combat phase
Artefact.Description: Counts as a spear. If the wielder causes an unsaved wound on an enemy, then that model and any other models in the unit that have not yet attacked suffer -1 to hit for that Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: The Spear of Twilight
Artefact.Description: This spear confers the Killing Blow ability on the wielder.

Artefact.Name: The Callach's Claw
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any unit suffering one or more unsaved wounds suffer an additional -1 penalty to their Leadership for the remainder of the Combat phase
Artefact.Description: Any unit suffering one or more unsaved wounds from this blade suffer an additional -1 penalty to their Leadership for the remainder of the Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: The Hunter's Talon
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May target any model it can see (including a character in a unit), but if this special ability is used, will suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty
Artefact.Description: If firing non-magical arrows the wielder of this longbow may target any model it can see (including a character that could normally not be targeted because it is in a unit or not the closest target), but if this special ability is used, will suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty. Note that the normal -1 penalty for shooting at a single man-sized model does not apply and the target cannot benefit from the "Look out, sir!" rule. The shooter may always choose a different target to the unit he is with.

Artefact.Name: The Sword of a Thousand Winters
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Characters and Monsters must take a Toughness test for each unsaved wound - their Strength, Initiative and Attacks are reduced by 1 for each test they fail
Artefact.Description: Characters and Monsters must take a Toughness test for each unsaved wound they suffer from this blade - their Strength, Initiative and Attacks are reduced by 1 (to a minimum or 1) for each test they fail.

Artefact.Name: Rageth's Wildfire Blades
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: Counts as two hand weapons. Any attacks made with these weapons count as Flaming.

Artefact.Name: Asyendi's Bane
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll all missed shooting attacks, if after this re-roll the shot still misses, then the bearer suffers a Strength 3 hit
Artefact.Description: The wielder of this longbow may re-roll all missed shooting attacks. However, if after this re-roll the shot still misses, then the bearer suffers a Strength 3 hit.

Artefact.Name: The Oaken Armour
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. The Oaken Armour gives the wearer the Regeneration ability.

Artefact.Name: Railarian's Mantle
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 4+ Ward Save within 6" of a Wood
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. If the wearer is within 6" of a Wood he receives a 4+ Ward Save.

Artefact.Name: Armour of the Fey
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 4+ Ward Save against any magical close combat attacks
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. Against any magical close combat attacks, the wearer receives a 4+ Ward Save.

Artefact.Name: The Helm of the Hunt
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 Attack and +1 Weapon Skill in charge
Artefact.Description: This helm confers a 6+ Armour Save that can be combined with other equipment as normal (including normal armour and a shield). When the character charges he receives +1 Attack and +1 Weapon Skill for that round of combat.

Artefact.Name: Briarsheath
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Enemies wishing to target the model with a shooting attack suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. Enemies wishing to target the model wearing the Briarsheath with a shooting attack suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty. This is increased to -2 if the wearer is within a wood.

Artefact.Name: The Rhymer's Harp
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May move through all kinds of difficult terrain without penalty
Artefact.Description: This item bestows a 5+ Ward Save on the bearer, their mount, and any unit they join. In addition, the bearer, their mount, and any unit they join may move through all kinds of difficult terrain without penalty.

Artefact.Name: Amaranthine Brooch
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Ward Save cannot be used against magical attacks
Artefact.Description: Grants the bearer a 3+ Ward Save that cannot be used against magical attacks.

Artefact.Name: Amber Pendant
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Enemy models in base contact automatically strike last
Artefact.Description: Any enemy models in base contact with the bearer of the Amber Pendant automatically strike last - even if they charged or have an ability that would allow them to normally strike first.

Artefact.Name: Stone of the Crystal Mere
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: If Ward Save is ever failed, then the Ward Save is lost for the rest of the game
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the stone gains a 3+ Ward Save, as does any creature ridden by the bearer. However, if this Ward Save is ever failed, then the stone shatters and the Ward Save is lost for the rest of the game.

Artefact.Name: Glamourweave
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 4+ Ward Save against shooting attacks and magic missiles
Any model attempting to strike the model in close combat must first pass a Leadership test: if they fail, they require 6+ to hit the bearer during that Combat phase
Artefact.Description: The Glamourweave conveys a 4+ Ward Save against shooting attacks and magic missiles. In addition, any model attempting to strike the bearer in close combat must first pass a Leadership test. If they fail, they require 6+ to hit the bearer during that Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: Stone of Rebirth
Artefact.Description: When the wearer is reduced to one Wound this item bestows a 2+ Ward Save.

Artefact.Name: The Fimbulwinter Shard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any creatures with the Forest Spirit special rule suffer from Stupidity while the bearer is within 6"
Artefact.Description: Opponents suffer a -1 to hit the bearer and his mount in close combat. Any creatures with the Forest Spirit special rule suffer from Stupidity while the bearer is within 6".

Artefact.Name: Merciw's Locus
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any model wishing to strike the model receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons
Artefact.Description: The bearer of this magic item receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons. However, any model wishing to strike the model that bears Merciw's Locus also receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons.

Artefact.Name: Wraithstone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: All enemy units within 6" suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership
Artefact.Description: All enemy units within 6" of the bearer of this stone suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Hagbane Arrows
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic arrows: a model that loses one or more wounds from Hagbane arrows must take a Toughness test, if the test is failed, the target is slain, ignoring Armour Saves and Ward Saves
Artefact.Description: Magic arrows. A model that loses one or more wounds from Hagbane arrows in any Shooting phase must take a Toughness test at the end of the phase. If the test is failed, the target is slain regardless of how many wounds it has left, ignoring Armour Saves and Ward Saves.

Artefact.Name: Moonstone of the Hidden Ways
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, if the character and any unit they have joined is wholly within a wood at the end of the Move phase, the character and unit may be removed from the table and replaced anywhere that is also wholly within a wood, facing in any direction and in any formation
Artefact.Description: One use only. If the character and any unit they have joined is wholly within a wood at the end of the Move phase, the character and unit may be removed from the table and replaced anywhere that is also wholly within a wood, facing in any direction and in any formation.

Artefact.Name: Hail of Doom Arrow
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, the arrow splits into 3D6 magical Strength 4 arrows
Artefact.Description: One use only. Magic arrow. When fired, the arrow splits into 3D6 magical Strength 4 arrows. Roll to hit for each arrow. If this is used with a magic bow, then any effects of the magic bow are ignored for this shot.

Artefact.Name: Starfire Arrows
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any unit that suffers one or more casualties from model shooting must take a Panic test, regardless of the number of casualties caused
Artefact.Description: Magic arrows. Any unit that suffers one or more casualties from Starfire Arrows must take a Panic test, regardless of the number of casualties caused.

Artefact.Name: The Horn of the Asrai
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: One per game, at the beginning of any enemy turn, all enemies able to charge the bearer of this item must take a Leadership test, if they fail, they must charge the bearer
Artefact.Description: One use only. Can be used at the beginning of any enemy turn. When used, all enemies able to charge the bearer of this item must take a Leadership test. If they fail, they must charge the bearer (charge reactions. Psychology tests etc. are taken as normal).

Artefact.Name: Arcane Bodkins
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic arrows with no Armour Saves are allowed
Artefact.Description: Magic arrows. No Armour Saves are allowed against Arcane Bodkins.

Artefact.Name: Elynett's Brooch
Artefact.Description: The wearer, and any unit they join, may re-roll failed Psychology tests.

Artefact.Name: Dragontooth Arrows
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any model wounded by Dragontooth Arrows suffers from the rules for Stupidity for the rest ot the game
Artefact.Description: Any model wounded by Dragontooth Arrows suffers from the rules for Stupidity for the rest ot the game - even if they are normally Immune to Psychology.

Artefact.Name: Gwytherc's Horn
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once perl game, the character and any unit joined become Immune to Psychology until the beginning of the next turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. At the start of any of the bearer's turns the horn may be blown. The bearer and any unit joined are Immune to Psychology until the beginning of the bearer's next turn.

Artefact.Name: Wand of Wych Elm
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any Dispel attempt can be re-rolled
Artefact.Description: This staff allows any Dispel attempt to be re-rolled.

Artefact.Name: Calaingor's Stave
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May add 1" to the distance they may move a forest if they successfully cast the spell Tree Singing
Artefact.Description: If the bearer has the spell Tree Singing, then they may add 1" to the distance they may move a forest if they successfully cast the spell (so, if successfully cast, they may move a forest D3 + 2"). In addition, they may cast (and attempt to cast) the spell more than once per Magic phase.

Artefact.Name: Divination Orb
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: If an opponent uses more than three dice when casting any spell, the character may add an extra free Dispel dice into the attempt to dispel that spell
Artefact.Description: If an opponent uses more than three dice when casting any spell, the bearer of the Divination Orb may add an extra free Dispel dice into the attempt to dispel that spell.

Artefact.Name: The Deepwood Sphere
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll the dice when determining the effects of the Tree Singing spell
All enemy models wholly or partly within the same wood as the bearer take a single Strength 5 hit at the start of each Wood Elf Magic phase
Artefact.Description: This item allows the mage to re-roll the dice when determining the effects of the Tree Singing spell (whether he is using it to move a wood or to inflict damage on an enemy within a wood). In addition, all enemy models wholly or partly within the same wood as the bearer take a single Strength 5 hit at the start of each Wood Elf Magic phase.

Artefact.Name: Ranu's Heartstone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game may re-roll one of the dice when casting a spell or making a Dispel attempt
Artefact.Description: Once per game, the bearer of this item may re-roll one of the dice when casting a spell or making a Dispel attempt. This can be used to prevent a miscast or cause a spell to be cast with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: The Royal Standard of Ariel
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any friendly unit within 12" of this banner receives Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: The enchantment that Ariel has woven into this banner causes the bearer, and any unit he joins, to cause fear. In addition, any friendly unit within 12" of this banner receives Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Gaemrath - the Banner of Midwinter
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game declare the banner's use at the beginning of the Movement phase, before declaring charges, the unit may not move or march but becomes Unbreakable until the start of the next player turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. Declare the banner's use at the beginning of the Movement phase, before declaring charges. The unit may not move or march but becomes Unbreakable until the start of the next player turn. This ability may be used if the unit is already engaged in close combat, but cannot be used if the unit is fleeing or skirmishing.

Artefact.Name: Faoghir - the Banner of Dwindling
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Enemies that flee from the unit having been beaten in close combat roll one dice less than normal to determine the distance they flee
Artefact.Description: Enemies that flee from the unit having been beaten in close combat roll one dice less than normal to determine the distance they flee.

Artefact.Name: Saemrath - the Banner of the Zenith
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The distance at which enemy models are prevented from marching by this unit is increased from 8" to 12"
Artefact.Description: The distance at which enemy models are prevented from marching by this unit is increased from 8" to 12".

Artefact.Name: Aech - the Banner of Springtide
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The unit may make a stand and shoot charge reaction even if the enemy charging them do so from within half their charge range
Artefact.Description: The unit may make a stand and shoot charge reaction even if the enemy charging them do so from within half their charge range.
